title: MSP430 compilation fails with "Error: r2 should not be used in indexed addressing mode"; fixed upstream

labels.name: A-LLVM
labels.description: Area: Code generation parts specific to LLVM. Both correctness bugs and optimization-related issues.

body:
Every Rust nightly as of approximately Jan 27, 2019 has [failed](https://travis-ci.org/cr1901/AT2XT/builds/504213832) to build my msp430 application due to assembler errors of the following form:

```
/home/travis/build/cr1901/AT2XT/target/msp430-none-elf/release/deps/at2xt-37ddc9c42139f11a.at2xt.wity2qy1-cgu.0.rcgu.s:574: Error: r2 should not be used in indexed addressing mode
```

This is due to [a bug](https://bugs.llvm.org/show_bug.cgi?id=39993) in the LLVM backend that has been [fixed upstream](https://github.com/llvm-mirror/llvm/commit/647ece596da48d462294067b2d19e5add1cf12b3), but hasn't managed to propagate downstream to `rustc` yet (thank you @pftbest for the help).

As I understand it, Rust only updates the LLVM backend occassionally, along with some patches; Is it possible to cherry pick this patch so that the msp430 backend works again before the next version bump? I would open this issue on the Rust LLVM fork, but Issues seems to be disabled for this repository...

## Meta
```
$ rustc --version
rustc 1.33.0-nightly (20c2cba61 2019-01-26)
```

[Source](https://travis-ci.org/cr1901/AT2XT/jobs/484942239#L434)
